title: EastEnders spoilers: Whitney and Callum have a heart-to-heart
text:
Callum and Whitney have a heart-to-heart (Picture: BBC)

Whitney Dean’s (Shona McGarty) wedding to Callum ‘Halfway’ Highway (Tony Clay) ended in disaster in EastEnders when she discovered that he’d slept with Ben Mitchell (Max Bowden). Unable to go through with the ceremony, she headed away on her honeymoon to regroup, before returning home with news of a new man in her life. However, in spite of how their relationship ended, she still very much cares for Callum — something which comes to light in upcoming episodes.

Whitney thought she’d found her perfect guy in Callum. He was sweet, kind and very humble, and the two embarked on a relationship that lasted over a year, but — in spite of his apparent happiness — Callum was harbouring a secret. He was secretly gay — something which Ben copped on to due to him having been through the same thing, and before long, the two men were unable to resist the chemistry between them, and spent the night together.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Unable to lie to Whitney any longer, Callum came clean on the night before the wedding, and — in spite of her making several attempts to do so — Whitney was unable to carry on with the ceremony, and instead decided to let her fiancé go, as she came to the realisation that they both deserve better than second best.

Ben and Callum walk in while Whitney is having a drink with Leo (picture: BBC)

Following her return to the Square, Callum and Whitney both made an attempt to move past what had happened between them and form a friendship.

In the coming episodes, Leo (Tom Wells) asks Whitney out for a drink and, although she initially indicates that she’d like to go, she changes her mind when Callum enters the cafe, and makes a quick exit.

Later in the week, Leo surprises Whitney at E20, before suggesting that they go back to his. However, Whitney is adamant the they remain where they are when Callum and Ben walk in.

Whitney gets drunk, and Callum heads over to check that she’s okay, and the pair end up having an emotional heart-to-heart.

Will this conversation perhaps allow them to leave the past behind and move on?

Or will it bring back old feelings for Whitney?

One to watch: Friday 18th October at 7:30pm on BBC One.
